results.title: Fetch Meeting Transcripts & Recordings - Teams
results.description: In this module, learn the process, scenarios, and APIs to fetch transcripts and recordings in the post-meeting scenario.

descriptions.content: In this module, learn the process, scenarios, and APIs to fetch transcripts and recordings in the post-meeting scenario.

results.title: DECLARE CURSOR (Transact-SQL) - SQL Server
results.description: Defines the attributes of a Transact-SQL server cursor, such as its scrolling behavior and the query used to build the result set on which the cursor operates.

descriptions.content: Unlike database APIs such as ODBC and ADO, FORWARD_ONLY is supported with STATIC, KEYSET, and DYNAMIC Transact-SQL cursors.
They can't be referenced by database API functions.
If FETCH NEXT is the first fetch against a cursor, it returns the first row in the result set.
NEXT is the default cursor fetch option.
The @@FETCH_STATUS function reports the status of the last FETCH statement.
